passages.text: Post the Call: Mixed with tough H1 set up, with likely LSD cut to FY26 EPS

Message from the conference Call was mixed, with on the positive side reassuring that it can deliver a sequential acceleration in growth and sustain margin though in all fairness management was non- committal on organic growth or organic EBIT progression. Net net as we wrote this morning, despite the FY25 beat we see pressure on FY26 earnings drivers and would expect LSD cut to FY26 on higher FX and perimeter impact while we also see some slight downside to consensus organic sales and EBIT. Key points: 1) very weak start to FY26 with weak Q1 likely \(- 5 - 6\%\) (aligned with Q125 - 5.9%) due to inventory destocks in China, the US and weak India, and tough start in Europe/Poland 2) sequential recovery throughout the year given India normalization, H2 stabilization in China, China Travel retail resuming, competitive performance in Europe, 3) management aims to protect margin, though it remains unclear to us whether organic margin will be at least flat \((\cos +20\) bps appears optimistics) given CFO mentioning GM pressure from tariffs, high bar from FY25 efficiencies and higher COGS from wet goods, 4) overall spirits market remain sudd, with limited potential to raise prices in major markets including the USA, where we expect inventory destocks to linger throughout the year. While the market has cheered FY25 beat and potential for sequential acceleration in organic performance in FY26, we believe the potential negative earnings momentum in FY26 with risk of LSD cut to consensus and a very weak start the the year reducing FY26 visibility may dent some of this after the stock re- rated to c16x PE26E calendar since June lows.

US destocking to persist through FY26. In the US the market excl. RTD is in slight decline (slight growth inc. RTD) with only Tequila growing but early greenshoots in Irish Whiskey category led by Jameson back into growth. Management noted distributor inventory adjustments post sell- in ahead of tariffs will be skewed to Q126 but will occur throughout FY26 as distributors work to avoid being too lean into OND. It has not seen price increases post tariffs to date given the environment is pressured with purchasing power weakness and consumer perceiving that prices remain high. Pernod is narrowing the gap to market with continued investments behind brands, innovation and expects a solid OND season. Pernod has also signed new distribution agreements with US partners designed to increase execution capabilities.

Indiandlerlying remains strong. In India management expects a weak Q1 impacted by \(50\%\) increase in excise rates in Maharashtra (one of the big states of Perod), leading to an estimated \(33\%\) upward revision in RSP. Imperial Blue disposal (to complete in FY26) was flagged to be immediately margin accretive. Management reiterated that the market fundamentals remain supportive for growth and expects FY26 growth at a similar level to FY25 \((+6\%)\) despite soft start in Q1.
China consumer backdrop remains soft. In China management flagged
Europe Equity Research 28 August 2025

In our view, the FY25 top- line growth and EBIT margin face downside risks amid continued weakness in the US, with still soft depletions, and in China, where consumer sentiment remains weak, further impacting Asia travel retail. We remain cautious on the Spirits segment overall and for Pernod, with risks to earnings amid weakening markets demand, normalising pricing and negative mix - admittedly sector- wide issues - while we await further clarity on actions Pernod will take to mitigate the China tariff impact. We see downside risks to timing a return to the lowered MT guide in the context of structural risks to Spirits demand. While we appreciate the company's LT opportunity to drive both top line and margin and the shares are now trading at a discount to the sector, we expect the shares to be held back in the near term by downside risks to earnings and the limitations of high leverage currently.

Our peer- multiple derived Dec- 26 PT is €120. We value the shares at 15x 2026E P/E, a 10% discount to International Spirits peers on calendar 2026E P/E (c.16x) given the greater risk profile (more EM exposure) for similar medium- term growth.

continued declines in Martell and Scotch, part of offset by growth in premium brands that have seen increased penetration. Management expects a weak Q126 on impact from inventory overhang post the conclusion of the anti- dumping investigation, as well as underlying consumption dragged by a lack sentiment and the reminder of the alcohol ban for government officials.

- Working to defend margin but not committing to flat yoy. Management has guided to defend margin to the fullest extent possible but is not committed to delivering flat margin in FY26 given uncertainties at this stage. Headwinds include: 1) Annualised tariff headwinds of €80m which will occur mostly in FY26; 2) Tough comps on COGS due to efficiencies in FY25 and COGS inflation as young whiskies distilled during higher inflation 3+ years come to market; 3) Price environment remaining subdued level; 4) China and US negative mix. This will aim to be offset by start of the €1bn FY26-29 productivity programme with clear initiatives (simplified organisation to leverage global scale, improved production operations) and looking to execute fast. On A&P management has committed to c.16% of sales (FY25 15.3%) with allocating resources to drive future growth and be agile and strategic in China. Pernod will maintain strict control of structure costs and optimizing these costs.

- Aiming to achieve 80% cash conversion. Management expects similar levels of FCF generation in FY26 with improving cash conversion ratio to c.80% in FY26 and 80%+ in FY27 and beyond. The improvement stems from continued normalization of strategic inventories and capex investments (target of below €900m in FY26), and ongoing operating working capital allocation.
Pernod- Ricard SA (Neutral; Price Target: €120.00)

In our view, the FY25 top- line growth and EBIT margin face downside risks amid continued weakness in the US, with still soft depletions, and in China, where consumer sentiment remains weak, further impacting Asia travel retail. We remain cautious on the Spirits segment overall and for Pernod, with risks to earnings amid weakening markets demand, normalising pricing and negative mix - admittedly sector- wide issues - while we await further clarity on actions Pernod will take to mitigate the China tariff impact. We see downside risks to timing a return to the lowered MT guide in the context of structural risks to Spirits demand. While we appreciate the company's LT opportunity to drive both top line and margin and the shares are now trading at a discount to the sector, we expect the shares to be held back in the near term by downside risks to earnings and the limitations of high leverage currently.

Our peer- multiple derived Dec- 26 PT is €120. We value the shares at 15x 2026E P/E, a \(10\%\) discount to International Spirits peers on calendar 2026E P/E (c.16x) given the greater risk profile (more EM exposure) for similar medium- term growth.
Source: Company reports and J.P. Morgan estimates. Note: € in millions (except per-share data). Fiscal year ends Jun. o/w - out of which

For all Korea-based Research Analysts listed on the front cover, if applicable, they also certify, as per KOFIA requirements, that the Research Analyst's analysis was made in good faith and that the views reflect the Research Analyst's own opinion, without undue influence or intervention.

All authors named within this report are Research Analysts who produce independent research unless otherwise specified. In Europe, Sector Specialists (Sales and Trading) may be shown on this report as contacts but are not authors of the report or part of the Research Department.
J.P. Morgan ratings or designations: OW = Overweight, N= Neutral, UW = Underweight, NR = Not Rated

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
